text: Small animal behaviour – cat behaviour These notes are broken into sections based on each video Video CB1 –Cat senses and communicating feelings Intended learning outcome Explain how a cat’s sensory experience of the world may influence its behavior in order to best understand the cat’s behaviour Apply an understanding of the normal body language and behaviour of cats in order to interpret their interactions with humans and other animals Success criteria Describe key features of a cat’s smell, sight, hearing, touch and taste Describe how those features may influence the behaviour of a cat in a given situation Describe the physical features of a cat’s eyes, ears, mouth, tail and posture/movement which indicate whether the dog is relaxed or anxious/fearful Describe behaviours which are likely to be seen in relaxed animals Describe behaviours which are likely to be seen in anxious/fearful animals Identify common behavioural and health responses to stress in cats Video CB2 – Preventing development of behavioural problems - kittens Intended learning outcome Describe strategies to prevent development of problem behaviours to maximise the welfare outcomes for humans and cats Success criteria Describe the importance of the socialisation period for a kitten’s future behavioural health Describe the importance of Kitten Kindy and outline key common behaviours that should be discussed Describe strategies to minimise inappropriate urination in cats Describe cat’s preferences for eating location and frequency Describe the importance of scratching behaviour in cats and strategies for encouraging cats to scratch in appropriate places Video CB3 – Behavioural husbandry of cats Intended learning outcome Describe strategies to prevent development of problem behaviours to maximise the welfare outcomes for humans and cats Success criteria Describe why behavioural husbandry is important in cats Describe different ways that cat can be exercised including environment and toys that can be used for indoor cats Describe the main resources that are important for cats Describe the varied social needs of cats and how these may be provided Describe some activities that can be used for non-social enrichment of cats
